Please turn on the "Work in progress" preference (External Tools -> Work in 
progress -> use launch configs". This should fix the problem. As well, I think 
this is a dup of bug 26042 - the action was not actually running anything.

Indeed, it works fine once toggling work in progress. 
Why do I have to do it at all ?

Also, I got mislead by the fact it no longer prompts me for chosing the target. 
This again is misleading, I need to perform more click action in various dialog.

What would instead be better is to have a:
run Ant>default target
       >choose target

Or instead, it would have to open the launch config dialog.

Actually, if using launch configs, why do I still have 'run Ant' at all ?
Shouldn't it simply be a 'Run' action opening the launch config (focused on 
selected item) ? Then Ant scripts should be listed amongst other launch configs.

The "work in progress" option will be removed shortly (it will become the only 
way to do things, by default).

We keep the ant configs seperate from run/debug configs as there is a 
conceptual difference - i.e. programs being developed vs. a tool used for 
developing.

In HEAD, the latest "Run Ant..." action does open the dialog (on the first 
run), to let you choose targets. We already have a bug opened to allow for 
prompting for targets/arguments (bug 25862).

"Run Ant" is a shortcut, just like "Run As -> Java Application".

The "Ant View" is designed to run targets dynamically - i.e. select and run 
specific targets.

*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of 25862 ***
